etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘contraction of body tissues’): from late Latin constipatio(n-), from the verb constipare (see constipated)

definitions: a condition in which there is difficulty in emptying the bowels, usually associated with hardened feces.
shortDefinitions: condition in which there is difficulty in emptying bowels, usually associated with hardened faeces

definitions: a high level of constraint or restriction; a pronounced lack of ease
shortDefinitions: high level of constraint or restriction
